Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants qualify as Convention refugees or persons in need of protection under Canadian law
Application_Facts: Applicants fled Costa Rica after alleged rape and threats, seeking refugee status in Canada
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; applicants failed to prove unavailability of state protection
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged rape and threats in Costa Rica
Legal_Standard: Applicants must demonstrate inability to access state protection in their home country; perfection in state protection is not required
Assessment_Factor: Effectiveness of state protection mechanisms in Costa Rica
Procedural_Issue: Application for judicial review following RPD rejection
Credibility_Assessment: Claims of ineffective police deemed insufficient without pursuing all avenues
Evidence_Used: RPD findings on existence of Ombudsman and special courts in Costa Rica
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to gender-based violence and threats
Relief_Sought: Recognition as Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Governing_Rule: Inability to access state protection in home country
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence showing state protection was unavailable in Costa Rica
Harm_Assessment: Alleged rape and threats in Costa Rica
Cause_Description: Applicants fled Costa Rica after alleged rape and threats, seeking refugee status in Canada
Evidence_Handling: RPD considered but rejected claims due to insufficient evidence of lack of state protection
Evidence_Issues: Failure to demonstrate exhaustion of protective avenues in Costa Rica
Evidence_Assessment: Applicants did not provide sufficient evidence to show state protection was inaccessible
Decision_Rationale: Costa Rica provides adequate state protection through institutions like the Ombudsman and special courts
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient proof of unavailability of state protection
Legal_Standard_Applied: Unable to access state protection in country of origin
